channel.title: Nature
channel.description: Nature is the foremost international weekly scientific journal in the world and is the flagship journal for Nature Portfolio. It publishes the finest peer-reviewed research in all fields of science and technology on the basis of its originality, importance, interdisciplinary interest, timeliness, accessibility, elegance and surprising conclusions. Nature publishes landmark papers, award winning news, leading comment and expert opinion on important, topical scientific news and events that enable readers to share the latest discoveries in science and evolve the discussion amongst the global scientific community.
channel.dc:rights: © 2025 Macmillan Publishers Limited, part of Springer Nature. All rights reserved.

item.title: Liquid-crystal specs refocus with the push of a button
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 02 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02786-2

Bifocals for the touchscreen era accommodate users who mix near- and far-sightedness.
item.dc:title: Liquid-crystal specs refocus with the push of a button

item.title: These ‘glass straw’ optical fibres could speed up the Internet
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 02 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02787-1

A cable design that sends light through air, rather than solid glass, could cut signal loss and make long-distance transmissions cheaper.
item.dc:title: These ‘glass straw’ optical fibres could speed up the Internet
item.dc:creator: Davide Castelvecchi

item.title: Unifying gravity and quantum theory requires better understanding of time
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 02 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02756-8

Textbooks give strange, imprecise explanations of where things happen in quantum mechanics. Consistency with gravity needs a fresh approach.
item.dc:title: Unifying gravity and quantum theory requires better understanding of time
item.dc:creator: Fay Dowker

item.title: Who is afraid of quantum mechanics? Books in brief
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 01 September 2025; doi:10.1038/d41586-025-02755-9

Andrew Robinson reviews five of the best science picks.
item.dc:title: Who is afraid of quantum mechanics? Books in brief
item.dc:creator: Andrew Robinson

item.title: Ultrabroadband on-chip photonics for full-spectrum wireless communications
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 27 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09451-8

Adaptive wireless communication over an unprecedented frequency range spanning over 100 GHz can be achieved by a thin-film lithium niobate photonic wireless system, which can process a large flux of information at high speed.
item.dc:title: Ultrabroadband on-chip photonics for full-spectrum wireless communications

item.title: Electrically driven lasing from a dual-cavity perovskite device
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 27 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09457-2

An electrically driven perovskite laser is constructed by vertically integrating a low-threshold single-crystal perovskite microcavity sub-unit with a high-power microcavity perovskite LED sub-unit.
item.dc:title: Electrically driven lasing from a dual-cavity perovskite device
item.dc:creator: Chen Zou
Zhixiang Ren
Kangshuo Hui
Zixiang Wang
Yangning Fan
Yichen Yang
Bo Yuan
Baodan Zhao
Dawei Di

item.title: Topological prethermal strong zero modes on superconducting processors
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 27 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09476-z

Stable and robust topological edge modes are observed at finite temperatures in an array of 100 programmable superconducting qubits because of emergent symmetries present in the prethermal regime of this system.
item.dc:title: Topological prethermal strong zero modes on superconducting processors

item.title: Attosecond control and measurement of chiral photoionization dynamics
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 27 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09455-4

By introducing chiroptical spectroscopy with attosecond pulses, attosecond coherent control over photoelectron circular dichroism is demonstrated and measurements of chiral asymmetries in the forward–backward and angle-resolved photoionization delays of chiral molecules are reported.
item.dc:title: Attosecond control and measurement of chiral photoionization dynamics
item.dc:creator: Meng Han
Jia-Bao Ji
Alexander Blech
R. Esteban Goetz
Corbin Allison
Loren Greenman
Christiane P. Koch
Hans Jakob Wörner

item.title: Dual-scale chemical ordering for cryogenic properties in CoNiV-based alloys
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 27 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09458-1

Dual-scale chemical ordering in CoNiV-based alloys improves the synergy of strength and ductility at cryogenic temperatures, providing an approach for obtaining high-performance metallic materials for cryogenic applications.
item.dc:title: Dual-scale chemical ordering for cryogenic properties in CoNiV-based alloys

item.title: Optical generative models
item.content:encoded:
Nature, Published online: 27 August 2025; doi:10.1038/s41586-025-09446-5

Optical generative models are demonstrated for the rapid and power-efficient creation of never-seen-before images of handwritten digits, fashion products, butterflies, human faces and Van Gogh-style artworks.
item.dc:title: Optical generative models
item.dc:creator: Shiqi Chen
Yuhang Li
Yuntian Wang
Hanlong Chen
Aydogan Ozcan
